title: Apple Leads the Magnificent 7 Stocks. Nvidia Shares Decline.
text: LIVE UPDATES | CONCLUDED Last Updated: March 27, 2024 at 7:45 PM EDT 2 days ago By Connor Smith Apple stock was leading the Magnificent Seven on Wednesday and was on track to outperform Nvidia by its second-largest margin of the year. Apple shares were up 1.7%, while Nvidia stock was down 2.8%. That means Apple was outpacing Nvidia by 4.5 percentage points. It’s the largest such lead since March 8, when Apple outpaced Nvidia by 6.57 percentage points, according to Dow Jones Market Data. It would be only the third time Apple outpaced Nvidia this year by 4 percentage points or more. “Not sure if this is the start of a broader risk unwind or just related to quarter end rebalancing,” writes Mizuho Securities' Daniel O'Regan.”Apple has been a source of funds for months to fund the Ai trade and touched multi-year lows vs the broader tech tape. Many are already asking if it has legs.” Nvidia's stock has surged 81% this year. Demand for its chips from artificial intelligence startups have driven results well above analysts' expectations. Apple's stock has fallen 10% this year. The Magnificent Seven stocks—which aside from Apple and Nvidia include Tesla, Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta Platforms—were mostly trading lower on Wednesday. Tesla was up 0.6%; Amazon was flat; Microsoft was down 0.2%; Alphabet was down 1%; while Meta was down 1.1%. Apple Inc. AAPL (U.S.: Nasdaq) NVIDIA Corp.
